result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Andrew Cappert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment terms as noted above for the Fine/Court Costs.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Andrew Cappert

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:05 AM Defendant Marcus Andrew Cappert in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: $100 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP,  DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus Andrew Cappert
Current: 224 North 3rd Street, Winneconne, WI 54986 United States  (Effective: 03-09-2022)
Prior: 224 N 3Rd Ave, Winneconne, WI 54986

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:56 PM Defendant Marcus Andrew Cappert appeared in court, Attorney Dennis Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant requests counsel - DE not eligible for SPD. Defendant wishes to speak with the DA regarding possible resolution. NGP entered.  Court orders $500 Sig Bond. PTC/P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
